stadium.name: The Stronghold Bailey
stadium.description: The team plays in the central bailey of Stronghold Castle, a massive fortress built on a plateau overlooking the city. The field is packed earth and cobblestone, and the crowd watches from the surrounding stone ramparts.

stats.pregame_ritual: Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Searching for a four-leaf clover near the sidelines.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Tying a red string around their pinky finger.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.
Searching for a four-leaf clover near the sidelines.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.

Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.

preGame: Well, pull up a crate and lend me your ears, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the magnificent Stronghold Bailey! üéôÔ∏è The New Ravenfall Commanders are playing host to those shimmering, self-righteous Haven Lights, and the atmosphere is absolutely thick with the scent of competition and damp cobblestones! We are high atop the plateau today, and that Castle Echo is making every pre-game chant sound like a thunderclap from the gods themselves! üè∞ The local fans are out in droves, practically hanging off the ramparts to cheer for their favorites, while the Haven supporters are looking a bit sparse‚Äîprobably too busy polishing their halos to make the trek! It is a beautiful day for a bit of the old ultra-violence, and the field is just begging for a little fresh paint‚Äîif you catch my drift! üõ°Ô∏è Over in the Commanders' dugout, Jozef Pepe is currently leading the pack by belching loud enough to rattle the windows of the Great Hall, while Croteau Osmo is meticulously tying a red string around their pinky for luck‚Äîlet's hope it stays attached to the finger! üß∂ Meanwhile, the Haven Lights are up to their usual 'virtuous' nonsense. Shiroma Salim is re-taping that Kirkhammer for the tenth time, and young Tybi Reo is busy drawing a troll head that looks more like a squashed melon than a trophy! üçà They might have the 'Shield's Watch' looking over them, but out here on the Cobblestone Pitch, even the twin lights can't save you from a Claymore to the ribs! üí• With the playoffs just around the corner, both teams are looking to make a statement! Will the Commanders find their victory as sweet as the honeycomb Estes Adrian is snacking on, or will the Haven Lights manage to 'hop' their way to a win like their healer, Riffle Harrington, and his tied-together bootlaces? üëü Grab your refreshments and keep your eyes on the shadows, because Tuesday Night Trollball is live! üëπüèà
postGame: What a day for the history books, folks! The New Ravenfall Commanders have successfully defended the Stronghold Bailey, taking down the Haven Lights with a final score of 2 to 1 in a match that was as jagged as the cobblestones themselves! ü¶¥ The action started with a bang as Croteau Osmo snatched the ball right out of the gate, but the 'heroes' from Haven weren't in a mood for games. Riffle Heyde, that mace-wielding menace, absolutely flattened Jozef Pepe early on, proving that even the most pious players have a bit of a mean streak when the leather starts flying! ü§ï The violence was just getting started, though! Wieren Ivar decided to welcome Croteau Osmo to the ground with a tackle that sounded like a bag of dry sticks breaking, sending the ball loose and Croteau to the sidelines! üèöÔ∏è It was a chaotic scramble for possession, with the Commanders trying to find their footing while Marlane Lounge played the heavy, knocking Jessalin Zobias into a stupor! It‚Äôs funny how those Haven folks talk about peace until they have a Main-gauche in their hands and a target in front of them! üèõÔ∏è Riffle Heyde continued their rampage, taking out both Dusa Curson and Theis Loredo in quick succession! I haven't seen that much carnage in a single half since Lord Orzalon tried to reorganize the Demon Prison! ü©∏ By the time the halftime whistle blew, the field looked more like a battlefield in Eponore than a sporting event, but thanks to the magic of the Everwar, every single one of those mangled athletes was back on their feet and ready for more punishment! üçñ The second half saw the Haven Lights finally find the basket! Riffle Heyde, after all that hitting, actually remembered there was a ball in play and found Wieren Ivar in the End Zone for a dunk! The few Haven fans in attendance went wild, probably thinking the Twinlights had blessed them, but their celebration was premature! üïØÔ∏è The Commanders roared back like a cornered beast! Croteau Osmo, returning from the infirmary with a vengeance, took a daring shot from way back in Center Field! The ball hummed through the Castle Echo and sailed right through the goal for a massive 2-point score, flipping the game and sending the rampart crowd into a state of absolute delirium! üéØ The Lights tried to mount a comeback, but their coordination fell apart faster than a cheap shield! Zwart Bunns and Riffle Heyde started dropping passes left and right, their hands shaking as the Commanders' defense turned up the heat! üî® Jozef Pepe got his pound of flesh, sending Zwart Bunns back to the dirt with a bone-crunching tackle, while Estes Adrian finished the job by taking Farand Keil out of the equation entirely! üî® Even with Riffle Harrington hopping around and doing his best to patch up the wounded, the Lights just couldn't find their rhythm under the weight of the Rampart Shadows. Those 'heroes' like the God King Artorias or that warlock Morgwae might celebrate their grit, but out here, grit doesn't mean much if you're unconscious in the dirt! ‚òÄÔ∏è In the end, the Commanders proved that home-field advantage and a bit of fermented fish can carry you a long way! They head into the playoffs with their heads held high and their weapons dripping, while the Haven Lights are left to lick their wounds and pray for a better season next year! üèÜ It‚Äôs been a glorious night of Trollball here in New Ravenfall, full of the kind of brutality that makes this the greatest sport in any reality! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off and reminding you: if you aren't bleeding, you aren't playing! Goodnight, Osterra! üåôüëπ
